clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Clemastine Fumarate + Dexamethasone Compared to Dexchlorpheniramine Maleate in Eczema Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Unicentric Comparing Effectiveness Superiority of to Clemastine Fumarate 1, 0 mg/g + Dexamethasone 0, 5 mg/g to Dexchlorpheniramine Maleate 10 mg/g in Eczema Treatment.

brief_summary.textblock: Atopic dermatitis is a recurrent pruritic skin disorder which has a significant morbidity and impaired quality of life due specially pruritus and physical visible skin lesions. The propose of this trial is evaluate the effectiveness of clemastine fumarate 1, 0 mg/g + dexamethasone 0, 5 mg/g compared to dexchlorpheniramine maleate 10 mg/g in eczema treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study design:
• Double blinded, superiority, prospective parallel-group, intend to treat trial.
Study design:
- Experiment duration: 22 days
- 2 visits (days 1,7,15 and 22)
- Reducing Eczema Area and severity index evaluation
- Adverse events evaluation

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction / improvement of signs and symptoms
primary_outcome.description: The reduction of signs an symptoms will be evaluated by OSAAD index.

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be collected and followed in order to evaluate safety and tolerability.

intervention.description: Clemastine fumarate 1,0 mg/g + dexamethasone 0,5/g applied 2 times / day at lesion
Dexchlorpheniramine maleate 10 mg/g applied 2 times / day at lesion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients must be able to understand the study procedures agree to participate and give written consent.
2. Patients with acute or sub-acute eczema.
3. Presence of symmetric lesions to compare on side to the other.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnancy or risk of pregnancy.
2. Lactation
3. Use of anti-inflammatory or immunosuppressive drugs (last 30 days prior to the study).
4. Sunlight over exposure in the last 15 days.
5. Any pathology or past medical condition that can interfere with this protocol.
